* Rewards: Arhat Hold Piece, Silk x2, Yarn x2, 1102 Experience, 1020 Will

## Where to Find First Prince of Flowing Sands

If you did kill the King (and made his Second Son very angry), you'll have gained a Pungent Flesh Chunk Key Item from defeating the duo. This item can be used at the very edge of the valley's cliff to summon the First Prince himself.

Preceding Text Summary:
The preceding text introduces the First Prince of Flowing Sands, an optional miniboss in *Black Myth: Wukong*. Players can encounter this Yaoguai Chief in Chapter 2, near Sandgate Village in a large valley cave. Defeating the miniboss unlocks secret bosses and rewards players with items such as Arhat Hold Piece, Silk, Yarn, Experience, and Will. Players can summon the miniboss using the Pungent Flesh Chunk obtained after defeating the King of Flowing Sands and his Second Son.

Image Summary:
The image depicts a large, intimidating creature with muscular features and animalistic traits, likely representing the First Prince of Flowing Sands. The creature's posture and environment suggest it is preparing for combat in a dark, cave-like setting, consistent with its role as a miniboss in the game.

Following Text Summary:
The following text explains alternative scenarios for summoning the First Prince of Flowing Sands. If the King of Flowing Sands was not killed during the earlier fight, he will summon the First Prince, who will then eliminate the King himself. If both the King and Second Son were defeated, players can use the Pungent Flesh Chunk to summon the First Prince directly from his lair.
